Used in #15373.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9f80e920c7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16770/commits/9f80e920c7a61dd335dcfbf71a67d70736dd5631)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ iInf_mul_iInf`
`+ le_iInf_mul_iInf`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

In `le_iInf_mul_iInf` and `iInf_mul_le_mul_iInf`, it seems that the hypotheses `(hu_top : âˆ€ x, u x â‰  âŠ¤)` and `(hv_top : âˆ€ x, v x â‰  âŠ¤)` could use existential quantifiers instead of universal quantifiers. Basically, the idea is that you want to avoid e.g. `f` infinite everywhere and `g` converging to 0, in which case `H` is vacuous but the conclusion is too strong. But existential quantifiers are enough to guarantee that neither `f` nor `g` are infinite everywhere.

Is this something you could prove instead?

On a side note: some time ago, we added things like [EReal.add_iInf_le_iInf_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/EReal.html#EReal.add_iInf_le_iInf_add). Given that `(EReal, +)` is isomorphic to `(ENNReal, *)` through the exponential, you may easily get some similar statements.

Edit: I think this suggestion is worth considering. On the dependent PR, you are proving `limsup_mul_le'`, which is a multiplicative version of [EReal.limsup_add_le_add_limsup](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/EReal.html#EReal.limsup_add_le_add_limsup). You might avoid a lot of work and prove a more general statement that way.

It would also be useful to keep similar names for such statements.

> Is this something you could prove instead?

This version is sufficient for my use case, but if you have formalized the more general version I would have no problem changing it.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11263451490/job/31321349301)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11263451490/job/31321349963)

LGTM but I have written most of the current content of the PR

maintainer merge

LGTM but I have written most of the current content of the PR

maintainer merge
We no longer have `supr`

```suggestion
  have h_le : (â¨† (k : â„•) (_ : n â‰¤ k), u k) â‰¤ B := by
```
What's the advantage over `iSup_subtype` directly?
I have removed this and inlined it in the proof of `iSup_le_top_of_bddAbove`.
As written in the comments, I think all those lemmas should be inlined

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/ENNReal/Real): add lemmas about iInf, iSup

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

In `le_iInf_mul_iInf` and `iInf_mul_le_mul_iInf`, it seems that the hypotheses `(hu_top : âˆ€ x, u x â‰  âŠ¤)` and `(hv_top : âˆ€ x, v x â‰  âŠ¤)` could use existential quantifiers instead of universal quantifiers. Basically, the idea is that you want to avoid e.g. `f` infinite everywhere and `g` converging to 0, in which case `H` is vacuous but the conclusion is too strong. But existential quantifiers are enough to guarantee that neither `f` nor `g` are infinite everywhere.

Is this something you could prove instead?

On a side note: some time ago, we added things like [EReal.add_iInf_le_iInf_add](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/EReal.html#EReal.add_iInf_le_iInf_add). Given that `(EReal, +)` is isomorphic to `(ENNReal, *)` through the exponential, you may easily get some similar statements.

Edit: I think this suggestion is worth considering. On the dependent PR, you are proving `limsup_mul_le'`, which is a multiplicative version of [EReal.limsup_add_le_add_limsup](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/EReal.html#EReal.limsup_add_le_add_limsup). It would also be useful to keep similar names for such statements.

This version is sufficient for my use case, but if you have formalized the more general version I would have no problem changing it.
